ArticleTitle.sentence: Cooperative interaction between Cra and Fnr in the regulation of the cydAB operon of Escherichia coli.

event.clue: Cooperative interaction between Cra and Fnr in the regulation of the cydAB operon of Escherichia coli.
Cooperative interaction between Cra and Fnr in the regulation of the cydAB operon of Escherichia coli.

AbstractText.sentence: In vivo and in vitro experiments are reported demonstrating that the catabolite repressor-activator (Cra) protein (formerly designated FruR) regulates expression of the cydAB operon of Escherichia coli encoding cytochrome d oxidase.

event.clue: In vivo and in vitro experiments are reported demonstrating that the catabolite repressor-activator (Cra) protein (formerly designated FruR) regulates expression of the cydAB operon of Escherichia coli encoding cytochrome d oxidase.

In vivo and in vitro experiments are reported demonstrating that the catabolite repressor-activator (Cra) protein (formerly designated FruR) regulates expression of the cydAB operon of Escherichia coli encoding cytochrome d oxidase.

In vivo and in vitro experiments are reported demonstrating that the catabolite repressor-activator (Cra) protein (formerly designated FruR) regulates expression of the cydAB operon of Escherichia coli encoding cytochrome d oxidase.

AbstractText.sentence: The Fnr protein is required for Cra-mediated transcriptional control, but the ArcA protein antagonizes the response to Cra.

event.clue: The Fnr protein is required for Cra-mediated transcriptional control, but the ArcA protein antagonizes the response to Cra.
The Fnr protein is required for Cra-mediated transcriptional control, but the ArcA protein antagonizes the response to Cra.

AbstractText.sentence: The results establish that Fnr, ArcA, and Cra exert their effects in an interdependent fashion.

event.clue: The results establish that Fnr, ArcA, and Cra exert their effects in an interdependent fashion.
